key_commands.description: Check overall pod status in the namespace to ensure components are running.
List services and exposed ports to identify relevant service and its port.
Inspect client service logs showing connection refused to post-storage-service on port 9090, indicating a connectivity issue.
Verify post-storage-service starts without internal errors, focusing the investigation on networking/config.

key_commands.command: exec_shell("kubectl get endpoints post-storage-service -n test-social-network -o wide")
key_commands.description: Check service endpoints and backend port (shows 10.244.1.22:8080), revealing the service routes to port 8080.
key_commands.original_command: exec_shell("kubectl get endpoints post-storage-service -n test-social-network -o wide")

key_commands.command: exec_shell("kubectl get deploy post-storage-service -n test-social-network -o yaml")
key_commands.description: Review deployment to confirm containerPort is 9090, establishing expected application listening port.
key_commands.original_command: exec_shell("kubectl get deploy post-storage-service -n test-social-network -o yaml")

key_commands.command: exec_shell("kubectl get svc post-storage-service -n test-social-network -o yaml")
key_commands.description: Inspect service spec to find targetPort is 8080, confirming mismatch with containerPort 9090 (root cause).
key_commands.original_command: exec_shell("kubectl get svc post-storage-service -n test-social-network -o yaml")

key_commands.description: Submit the identified faulty component responsible for the misconfiguration.
